title: new​
content: </> Maid.new() → Maid Constructs a new Maid object local maid = Maid.new()

title: isMaid​
content: </> Maid.isMaid(value: any) → boolean Returns true if the class is a maid, and false otherwise. print(Maid.isMaid(Maid.new())) --> true print(Maid.isMaid(nil)) --> false

title: Destroy​
content: </> Maid.Destroy() → () Alias for Maid.DoCleaning()

title: __index​
content: </> Maid:__index(index: any) → MaidTask Returns Maid[key] if not part of Maid metatable local maid = Maid.new() maid._current = Instance.new("Part") print(maid._current) --> Part maid._current = nil print(maid._current) --> nil

title: __newindex​
content: </> Maid:__newindex( index: any, newTask: MaidTask ) → () Add a task to clean up. Tasks given to a maid will be cleaned when maid[index] is set to a different value. Task cleanup is such that if the task is an event, it is disconnected. If it is an object, it is destroyed. Maid[key] = (function) Adds a task to perform Maid[key] = (event connection) Manages an event connection Maid[key] = (Maid) Maids can act as an event connection, allowing a Maid to have other maids to clean up. Maid[key] = (Object) Maids can cleanup objects with a `Destroy` method Maid[key] = nil Removes a named task.

title: GiveTask​
content: </> Maid:GiveTask( task: MaidTask-- An item to clean ) → number-- taskId Gives a task to the maid for cleanup, but uses an incremented number as a key.

title: GivePromise​
content: </> Maid:GivePromise(promise: Promise<T>) → Promise<T> Gives a promise to the maid for clean.

title: DoCleaning​
content: </> Maid:DoCleaning() → () Cleans up all tasks and removes them as entries from the Maid. note Signals that are already connected are always disconnected first. After that any signals added during a cleaning phase will be disconnected at random times. tip DoCleaning() may be recursively invoked. This allows the you to ensure that tasks or other tasks. Each task will be executed once. However, adding tasks while cleaning is not generally a good idea, as if you add a function that adds itself, this will loop indefinitely.

title: CheckInput​
content: </> SecureInput.CheckInput( player: Player ,-- Player who the input came from distance: number,-- The distance of player when input got activated input: any-- The input ) → ( boolean,-- If click is valid string-- Reason ) Makes argument a boolean

title: new​
content: </> SecureInput.new( parent: Instance -- To what should the input be parented to? ) → () Creates a new secure input

title: Block​
content: </> SecureInput:Block( player: Player -- Targeted player ) → () Adds player to the public blacklist

title: Unblock​
content: </> SecureInput:Unblock( player: Player -- Targeted player ) → () Removes player from the public blacklist

title: Timeout​
content: </> SecureInput:Timeout( player: Player ,-- Targeted player seconds: number-- Amount of time to wait before removing player from public blacklist ) → () Blocks player for given amount of time for every clickdetector

title: ConnectActivated​
content: </> SecureInput:ConnectActivated( func: (playerWhoActivated: Player ) → ()-- The function to connect to ) → RBXScriptConnection  Runs given function if input is valid

title: AddInput​
content: </> SecureInput:AddInput( inputType: string,-- Type of input, current types: "ClickDetector", "ProximityPrompt" and "VRHandInteract" properties: {[string]: any}?-- Properties of instance ) → () Adds new input

title: SetMaxActivationDistance​
content: </> SecureInput:SetMaxActivationDistance( distance: number-- New max activation distance ) → () Changes max activation distance

title: Enable​
content: </> SecureInput:Enable() → () Enables input (Note, input is enabled by default)

title: Disable​
content: </> SecureInput:Disable() → () Disables input

title: Destroy​
content: </> SecureInput:Destroy() → () Disconnects all connections and removes inputs

title: TableToString​
content: </> Utils.TableToString( tbl: {]: any},-- The table that becomes a string label: string?,-- Add a label to string (like a title) deepPrint: boolean?-- Also tables in the given table ) → string Makes given table a string, label can be added or "TABLE" would be used as default. Use deepPrint for also adding tables that are in the table!

title: isSignal​
content: </> Signal.isSignal(value: any) → boolean Returns whether a class is a signal

title: new​
content: </> Signal.new() → Signal<T> Constructs a new signal.

title: Fire​
content: </> Signal:Fire( ...: T-- Variable arguments to pass to handler ) → () Fire the event with the given arguments. All handlers will be invoked. Handlers follow

title: Connect​
content: </> Signal:Connect( handler: (...T) → ()-- Function handler called when :Fire(...) is called ) → RBXScriptConnection  Connect a new handler to the event. Returns a connection object that can be disconnected.

title: Wait​
content: This is a yielding function. When called, it will pause the Lua thread that called the function until a result is ready to be returned, without interrupting other scripts. Yields </> Signal:Wait() → T Wait for fire to be called, and return the arguments it was given.

title: Destroy​
content: </> Signal:Destroy() → () Disconnects all connected events to the signal. Voids the signal as unusable. Sets the metatable to nil.
